data.title: 2 : To which of the following countries the Treaty of Frankfurt 1871 forced to give up some territor
meta_keywords: To which of the following countries the Treaty of Frankfurt 1871 forced to give up some territories to Prussia
data.meta_description: Question of Class 10-exercise-2 : To which of the following countries the Treaty of Frankfurt 1871 forced to give up some territories to Prussia
data.text:
Frequently Asked Questions

When was the Rowlatt Act passed by the British

A: 1919

B: 1918

C: 1917

D: 1916

Solution:

Correct Option is: (A) 1919

Explanation:

The Rowlatt act of 1919 was passed on the recommendations of the Sedition Committee chaired by Sir Sidney Rowlatt.

Due to this act, the government got more powers to repress political activities and allowed the detention of political prisoners without trial for two years.

Simon Commission arrived in India in

A: 1924

B: 1926

C: 1928

D: 1930

Solution:

Correct Option is: (C) 1928

Explanation:

After Sir John, Allsebrook Simon chaired the Indian Legal Commission, commonly known as the Simon Commission, 1928 (February 3, 1928, and 1929) to study the possibility of a constitutional amendment. Allsebrook Simon was sent to India in October month of the year 1928). In 1930, the Commission published two volumes, also known as the Simon Report.

Name the writer of the book Hind Swaraj

Solution:

Explanation :

It is in this book that Gandhi reported his life's central goal interestingly: moral recovery of Indians and political liberation of Mother India.

Rear Swaraj instructs "the good news of affection instead of that of disdain. It replaces savagery with altruism. It pits soul force against savage power".

Final Answer :

The book Hind Swaraj was composed by Mahatma Gandhi in 1909. In it his perspectives on Swaraj, current development and motorization have been communicated.

In this book he pronounced that British rule was laid out in India with the collaboration of Indians, and had endured simply because of this participation.

Assuming Indians wouldn't collaborate, British rule in India would implode in the span of a year, and swaraj would come.

What was the main aim of the French revolutionaries

Solution:

Explanation :

The French Revolution endured a long time from 1789 to 1799. It started on July 14, 1789 when progressives raged in a jail called the Bastille.

The transformation reached a conclusion in 1799 when a general named Napoleon ousted the progressive government and laid out the French Consulate (with Napoleon as pioneer).

Final Answer :

The principal point of the French revolutionaries was

➔To oust the monarchical rule and the 'Ancien system' in France and the foundation of a conservative government.

➔To make a feeling of aggregate character among the French public by restricting the domain framework.

Who were Marianne and Germania

What was the importance of the way in which they were portrayed

Solution:

Explanation :

During the French insurgency, specialists utilized the female moral story to depict the thoughts like Liberty, Justice and the Republic.

A few female purposeful allegories were concocted in the nineteenth century, specifically Marianne and Germania.

Final Answer :

Marianne and Germania were individual female purposeful allegories for the French and the German country. They remained as embodiments of goals like 'freedom' and 'the republic'.

The significance of how they were depicted lay in the way that the general population could relate to their representative importance, and this would impart a feeling of public solidarity in them.
